course.title: Religions of Latin America
course.faculty_text: David L. Carrasco (Divinity School and FAS)
course.description: Examines the history of religions in Latin America including pre-Hispanic, colonial and contemporary mythologies, ritual practices and symbols integrating archaeological, artistic, documentary, and ethnographic source materials. Topics to be investigated include cosmology and worldview, ritual violence and sacred landscapes, saints and shamanism, miracles and religious healing, indigenous ancestor worship and African diasporic devotions, goddesses and women's roles, liberation theology and Latino/a religious themes.
course.notes: Offered jointly with the Divinity School as 3705.
